forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 68. West southwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between 11pm and 5am, then a chance of rain showers and patchy fog. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 62. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening drapes its soft veil over Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere hints at the coastal charm that characterizes this city by the bay. A lingering patch of fog dances close to the horizon, whispering secrets to the golden skyline while the westerly winds carry with them the earthy aroma of impending rain. The temperature sits comfortably around sixty-two, but as night deepens, the humidity rises, inviting the cool embrace of layers. Tonight, the sky wears a shroud of clouds, punctuated by occasional glimpses of that elusive moon, and the chance of rain showers flirts unpredictably, suggesting a quick drizzle might grace our streets.

Given these conditions, sensible attire is wise; light jackets will serve well against the gentle chill, while perhaps a hat to navigate the variable mist. Whether one chooses the quietude of an evening stroll along the waterfront or savors a cozy evening at a local café, the charm of San Francisco remains undiminished. A chance encounter with the rain may even transform the ordinary into the extraordinary, creating a moment to remember in a city that thrives on surprises.
